results.title: Leaving Las Vegas (D)
results.creator_credit: Mike Figgis, Anne Stewart, Lila Cazès and Initial Productions (US)
results.brief_description: This unlikely love story between a prostitute and an alcoholic won Nicholas Cage an Oscar for Best Actor as well as accolades from various other film festivals. Alcoholic screenwriter Ben, (Nicholas Cage) having lost his wife, child and now his job heads to Las Vegas on a mission to drink himself to death. He picks up prostitute Sera (Elizabeth Shue), they share a night together, numerous drinks and form a semblance of a relationship. She is aware of his mission, his lack of commitment and his love for alcohol which may surpass that of his feelings for her, but desperately clings to him for companionship. They form a relationship on the agreement that she will not ask him to stop drinking. The film is clouded by the halo of Ben’s alcoholism and Sera’s unhappy situation, but is lifted by the strange tenderness they share. Also starring Julian Sands and Richard Lewis.

results.title: La Commune (Paris 1871)
results.creator_credit: Peter Watkins, Paul Saadoun, 13 Productions, Arte, La Sept and Le Musee D'Orsay
results.brief_description: Filmmaker and media critic Peter Watkins directs this epic documentary on the Paris Commune of 1871, an event following the Franco-Prussian War in which France was defeated. Whilst the reign of Napoleon III collapsed, a disgruntled group of commoners decided to take charge, creating their own commune within Paris, thus forming a separatist government that adhered to a type of Marxist ethos. In Watkins’ treatment of the event, he effectively critiques modern media as well as commenting upon the illusive and subjective nature of history. Over 200 mostly non-professional actors re-enact the era, slipping in and out of character, discussing their views on the events they are representing. Two rival 19th century TV stations report on the insurrection; one is directed from within the commune and the other is a CNN type of organisation presenting a sensationalist view. Frightened Parisians are interviewed and argue constantly about the validity of the issues, including the rights of women, education issues, the role of the Church and freedom of the press, as the battle for Paris rages. Watkins’ film is a fascinating view of a little known historical period as well as an evocative and thought-provoking meditation upon our media saturated lives and the power of television. Watkins challenges the constraints of documentary filmmaking dictated by networks and liberates his six-hour story from such limitations. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: L.A. Story
results.creator_credit: Mick Jackson, Daniel Melnick, Indieprod and L. A. Films
results.brief_description: Steve Martin wrote this romantic comedy, in which he stars as Harris K. Telemacher, a Los Angeles wacky weatherman extraordinaire. After growing increasingly distanced from his socialite girlfriend Trudi (Marilu Henner) and unhappy with his job, he finds his spirit renewed by the arrival of a British journalist (Victoria Tennant). An oddball, but very amusing look at the faux pas and foibles of life in modern Los Angeles.

results.title: L'Atalante
results.creator_credit: Jean Vigo, Jacques Louis-Nounez, Argui-Films and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: This simple love story involves a young barge skipper who installs his new wife on his barge which he works with an older man, Jules. The marriage falters and the wife deserts him in Paris. The film’s reputation and influence stems from the way Vigo injects an imaginary dream-like quality into more conventional passages of lyricism and the direct portrayal of working class life. In contrast to the couple the exotic, tattooed figure of Jules was a focus for Vigo. The intensity of the emotions and the strangeness of the images has been variously labelled ‘poetic realism’ and ‘surreal lyricism’. Cast includes Michel Simon, Dita Parlo and Jean Daste. In French with English subtitles. This restored version includes an additional 8 min. of footage.

results.title: Kurt & Courtney
results.brief_description: Nick Broomfield’s controversial documentary “Kurt & Courtney” looks at the volatile relationship between Nirvana rock legend Kurt Cobain and Courtney Love, whose career as lead singer of Hole and as an actress took off not long after Cobain’s death. As well as attempting to delve into the psyches of Cobain and Love (aka Frances Farmer), Broomfield looks at the various theories surrounding Cobain’s death, which was shrouded in mystery and which instantly became part of the long list of conspiracy theories which our society finds so compelling. Broomfield’s documentary is in no way objective, but it is fascinating to watch, as the director pointedly incorporates his own battle to get his film made with Courtney Love vehemently attempting to stop the film. With home footage of Cobain and interviews with people who knew Cobain and Love, this is a must see for Nirvana fans (although due to legal constraints Broomfield could not use any music by Nirvana in the film). Curiously Kurt remains a shadowy figure in the film, and you actually get a stronger sense of Courtney Love as well as the various ‘hangers on’ who Broomfield interviews throughout the film.

results.title: Kostas
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Bernard Eddy, Film Victoria and Videoscope Australia
results.brief_description: A lonely Melbourne divorcee falls in love with a Greek taxi driver. The film explores the path the romance follows, and how the couple overcome their differences of class and culture. Starring Wendy Hughes, Takis Emmanuel, Kris McQuade, Chris Haywood.

results.title: Knud
results.creator_credit: Jorgen Roos, Contemporary Films and Nuna Film
results.brief_description: The story of Knud Rasmussen, an explorer from Denmark. Charts his private and public life on his expeditions across the North American Arctic. Commentary by Palle Koch.

results.title: King David
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Martin Elfand, Paramount Pictures and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Traces the life of the lowly shepherd boy who ascended to the throne of ancient Israel from his childhood battle with Goliath to his self-destructive passion for Bathsheba. Stars Richard Gere.

results.title: Jerry Maguire (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Cameron Crowe, James L. Brooks and Gracie Films
results.brief_description: Jerry Maguire set Hollywood abuzz in 1996 because it seemed to represent a return to films about people. Jerry Maguire (Tom Cruise) is a sports agent who starts to re-evaluate his success driven life. During a conference Jerry writes out a mission statement under a storm of inspiration, distributing it to everyone. When he gets back to work he discovers he’s been sacked and is left with only one client, Rod Tidwell (Cuba Gooding Jr) and one loyal employee, Dorothy Boyd (Renee Zellweger). Now Jerry has to struggle for his survival both as a sports agent and in his personal life as he is drawn into the lives of Dorothy and her son Ray (Jonathan Lipnicki). Cameron Crowe wrote and directed this heart warming romantic comedy which has lots to say about the commerce driven world we live in. Cuba Gooding Jr received and Oscar for Best Supporting Actor (1997) and Tom Cruise received a Golden Globe Award (1997) for Best Actor in a Comedy/Musical.
